content:
Saturday, Oct 4th at Wentworth, according to https://www.fsf.org/blogs/community/fsf40-celebration-registration

$50 to attend or buy a membership for $120.

"The program, which is jam-packed with talks and roundtable discussions
by important community members, starts at 10:00 EDT and will run
through 17:30 EDT. The celebration will be followed by the annual
associate member meeting from 17:45 to 19:00 EDT. After the associate
member meeting, we cordially invite you to hang out at a local bar
with us to round the celebration off."
See also #boston > 2025-10 meetup where we're deciding where to meet in October.

I found these blog posts that give some indication of who will be speaking:

  • https://www.fsf.org/news/fsf40-foundation-panel
  • https://www.fsf.org/news/fsf40-volunteer-panel

I'm not sure why a program hasn't been posted, that I can find anyway, a list of titles and speakers.
I didn't notice that the registration had a deadline. 45 minutes ago. Well they say they can accommodate in-person registrations if they have space. I wonder if this is more popular than LibrePlanet.
Yeah, I noticed the deadline but I didn't register. I dunno, I'd like to see titles and abstracts for talks.
FDroid is interesting enough. Not to mention that it's a pivotal moment now for them as Android is closing it's walls.

I was told by the FSF40 organizers:

"It would be fabulous if you would come by. We'll meet at 19:30 at Boston Timeout Market at 401 Park Drive, Boston MA 02215."

So! Let's go! See also #boston > 2025-10 meetup for how I updated the website to say we're going. :smile:
@Dan thanks for tooting! :elephant:

Also sort of related to FSF40 in an unofficial way:

https://mobilizon.us/events/552e45dd-b30f-42b3-bbd8-656031c84cf9

Tomorrow evening. I'll be there as well.

On a side note this is using Mobilizon which is on the Fediverse. I was hoping it would have more interoperability with Mastodon. I can follow the account and boost the event. But if I reply to the event it doesn't come up as a comment. At least I don't see it yet.
